subject: Re: Running JUnit tests against a .jar file
msgSnippet: Run ant with the -verbose option, and check if your .jar file is added to the path. Maybe, the .jar is not yet available when your path is generated, because

Run ant with the -verbose option, and check if your .jar file is 
added to =
the path.

Maybe, the .jar is not yet available when your path is generated=
, 
because you are creating the jar later in your build?

Regards, Jan
